intro: Chaetophora, commonly known as the "feather moss," is a genus of mosses belonging to the family Dicranaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, branching stems and small, overlapping leaves that often have a serrated or toothed margin. Chaetophora species typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. They play an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in their ecosystems. The genus includes several species, each with slight variations in morphology and habitat preferences.
